posts.name: Vihan Bansal
posts.cooked: Hi my name is Vihan Bansal and I am part of Team 3624’s software team which is spearheading our new implementation of swerve drivetrain for this year. We are using the thrifty v2 with spark flexes and vortexes. As for our code, we are using a template code from the Bronc Bots (I will link iur code below). Currently, we are having issues with our robot when we put it on the floor and start driving it. When we have it up off the floor it works perfectly fine. We have done pid tuning and offset before and have also looked on YAGSL ’s website and forums (configuration, when to invert, etc.). I will attach a video that shows our problem. Thank you in advance. Our code Video

We think we know what is causing this issue and it will be fixed tonight with the official release of YAGSL 2025

In the mean time can you upload your code to github. I can’t easily look at it when its in google drive.

Can you also send a video of this in Elastic?

posts.name: Mohammad Wasim
posts.cooked: We can’t send a video in Elastic. Would you prefer we send it in any other way? If you can’t access the google drive we can upload the video to youtube.
You can point a phone at your computer and upload that video to google drive. code reviews in google are awful and I generally refuse to do them

posts.name: Mohammad Wasim
posts.cooked:
So we adjusted the gear ratio, updated all of the code and libraries, and tuned our offset while the robot was on the floor. It is still somewhat not driving fully straight as you will see in this video, but the robot is also driving robot centric for some reason, the default commands are still field oriented angular velocity.

VIDEO https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ixUKD5lT3kb7citWkUYjiWdFA9xctvWJ/view?usp=sharing

CODE https://github.com/frc3624/REEFSCAPE2025

posts.name: Vihan Bansal
posts.cooked:
We, Team 3624, are trying to implement swerve for the first time using YAGSL , thrifty v2, sparkflexes, Cancoders, and vortexes. We have since adjusted the gear ratio, updated all of the code and libraries, and tuned our offset while the robot was on the floor. It is still somewhat not driving fully straight as you will see in this video, but the robot is also driving robot centric for some reason, the default commands are still field oriented angular velocity.

VIDEO

Google Drive file.

CODE

GitHub - frc3624/REEFSCAPE2025 Contribute to frc3624/REEFSCAPE2025 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Contribute to frc3624/REEFSCAPE2025 development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Maroon Golf
posts.cooked: It looks like the heading correction is disabled in your swerve subsystem. Line 100

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: How can you have any pudding if you don't eat your meat!

posts.custom_user_title: How can you have any pudding if you don't eat your meat!

posts.name: Mohammad Wasim
posts.cooked: Tried that, didn’t work. All of our drive angular velocity commands are set to field oriented, we’re not really sure what the problem is.

There was a known bug with one of the drive functions that is going to be released with the next version. The next version should come out tomorrow. The Example has a functional field oriented command. You should use that until the next update.

posts.name: Maroon Golf
posts.cooked: Next things I would verify is that your gyro reading is updating in your dashboard, and make sure you are running YAGSL version 2025.2.1
